reasoning: X-linked hypodontia is a genetic condition affecting tooth development. Estimated incidence ~0.4-0.8 per 100k live births for X-linked forms. Often associated with ectodermal dysplasia syndrome. Most epidemiological data from case reports and clinical registries rather than population surveys.
source: Vastardis H et al. (1996). A human MSX1 homeodomain missense mutation causes selective tooth agenesis. Nat Genet. 13(4):417-421
